required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dilute Povidone-iodine Irrigation vs No Irrigation for Children With Acute, Perforated Appendicitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Pilot Trial of Dilute Povidone-iodine Irrigation vs No Irrigation for Children With Acute, Perforated Appendicitis

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to compare the efficacy of PVI irrigation to no irrigation for decreasing postoperative intra-abdominal abscesses in children with perforated appendicitis. Additionally, this study aims to verify the safety profile of dilute PVI for intra-abdominal irrigation.

detailed_description.textblock: Postoperative intra-abdominal abscesses are common occurrences after perforated appendicitis in pediatric patients despite utilization of evidence-based practices. Povidone-iodine is a commonly used antiseptic in surgical procedures and has been shown to be effective in reducing postoperative abscesses in adults with perforated appendicitis. This trial will be the first to rigorously test the efficacy of povidone-iodine irrigation in children and to verify its safety profile in this patient population.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Postoperative Intra-abdominal Abscess
primary_outcome.description: 30 days postoperative intra-abdominal abscess was confirmed by an image using a standardized definition and protocol

secondary_outcome.description: Total hospital length of stay will be the aggregate of all days in the hospital including any appendicitis-related readmissions within 30 postoperative days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Readmitted to the Hospital
secondary_outcome.description: Whether or not a patient was readmitted to the hospital within 30 days after the operation will be determined through chart review, clinical encounters, and phone calls.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Visited the Emergency Room
secondary_outcome.description: Whether or not a patient visited the emergency room for care directly related to the operation within 30 days after the operation will be determined through chart review, clinical encounters, and phone calls.

intervention.description: Povidone-iodine (PVI) is an antiseptic solution consisting of polyvinylpyrrolidone with water, iodide, and 1% available iodine. It has bactericidal ability against a large array of pathogens, including those pathogens which commonly cause postoperative IAA in children with perforated appendicitis. 1% PVI will be used. Once the appendix has been removed and hemostasis ensured, the surgeon will perform the irrigation with 10cc/kg (minimum 100ml and maximum 1000ml) of 1% PVI. After completing the irrigation, the surgeon will suction out all intra-abdominal fluid into a suction canister.
Patients allocated to the control group will not undergo intra-abdominal irrigation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who undergo an appendectomy for perforated appendicitis. (Appendicitis: Diagnosis is made intraoperatively by the surgeon. Diagnosis Method: The visualization of a gross defect in the appendiceal wall or the presence of intraperitoneal stool or a fecalith at the time of operation.)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients presenting with simple or gangrenous appendicitis
- Patients with a history of iodine sensitivity, thyroid disease or renal disease
- Patients undergoing interval or incidental appendectomy
- Patients/parents/legal guardians who are both non-English and non-Spanish speaking

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Of 372 subjects consented, 100 were enrolled as these subjects had perforated appendicities

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
